events.text: To have it so that the powerup that you collected in level 1 is still having effects in level 2

actions.text: This is because platform behavior doesn't work well with physics behavior
The gravity of all objects so that the sprites have a earth gravity type movement and gameplay
The player will move at the same speed no matter the density and as you have to push objects the denser objects will be more powerful and the less dense objects are the one to be pushed
To provide limitation to how far we can jump

children.text: Jump made using the physics behavior
If the player is on ground, as it as an impulse, at the moment, the jump height will become negative to indicate that the player is on the ground and can jump now
We want to move the object left and right and not up and down

As with the physics behavior, you can jump as much as you want, this code makes it so that you can jump/overlap over specific objects preventing it from getting unlimited jump and it will check if you are on ground so that means you can overlap these objects only
If you are not overlapping these objects, on ground will be set to false, implying that you will always be on ground if you are overlapping these objects
This will give the see saw a more see saw like feel and give it a sort of up and down motion as it -60 and 60 degrees will give let it move that way

Every tick, the player will set its position to playerbox, and every tick check if lava enemy is on-screen the lava sprite will be above exactly above the playerbox and once the timer is finished the lava sprite will fall on top of the playerbox

When lava collides with the playerbox it will destroy itself and then the player will flash, and then it will check which button the player clicked on the beginning of the menu screen, where you get less damage from one of the enemies' attacks, and give that much damage accordingly
If the player clicked on the none button, it would set the pickednone boolean to true, and if the player collected the powerup in the first level, it will deal you 2 damage, otherwise 3

Whenever the lava enemy is on-screen it will create lava on top of the playerbox's head and it will trigger once or else once you defeat the lava enemy it will be gone forever, so every time it is on-screen it will start a timer and create lava sprite
If the lava sprite is less than 1000 on the y axis it will destroy itself to prevent lag in the game
If playerbox collides with the lava enemy, the player will flash to show that it got damaged, and then it will check whether the player has collected a powerup or not, and give damage accordingly
This is to help the player go back if they missed the key
If the playerbox picked the key earlier in the level it will go to the win screen or else nothing will happen
